UI.noInput: Please answer before viewing the solution

question: Believed to be the earliest known musical instrument, a Neanderthal flute made out of bear bone was found in Slovenia and dated to around 50,000 years ago. How might an archaeologist determine how an ancient musical instrument was made and who made it? Hear it being played: https.//youtu.be/sHy9FOblt7Y

answers.text: Look at archaeological records for other similar artifacts
Refer to present-day cultural groups that use a similar instrument
Use experimental archaeology to reconstruct the instrument with tools the Neanderthals would have had access to
Conduct further excavations for other evidence of similar instruments
